answers.answer: Hi!Pain along one side of foot with numbness of toes can either be due to pinched nerves in ankle or due to peripheral neuropathy secondary to diabetes, hypothyroidism, lupus etc. Faulty foot wear can also cause nerve compression, so check this aspect. You can try dipping your feet in warm water and doing foot and toe exercises. Also rotational exercises and stretch exercises of ankle joint may help. Please consult your doctor regarding this.Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

question: I get a lot of pain in my left side foot and then my toes goes numb. Can you tell me what I have?CZAG
title: Foot and Toes Problem
